verses.latin: Paulus, apostolus Iesu Christi per voluntatem Dei, sanctis qui sunt Ephesi, et fidelibus in Christo Iesu.
verses.english: Paul, a commissioned apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, to the holy ones who are at Ephesus, and to the faithful in Christ Jesus.

verses.latin: Gratia vobis, et pax a Deo Patre nostro, et Domino Iesu Christo.
verses.english: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.latin: Benedictus Deus et Pater Domini nostri Iesu Christi, qui benedixit nos in omni benedictione spiritali in caelestibus in Christo,
verses.english: Blessed be God and the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us with every spiritual blessing in the universe, in Christ,

verses.latin: sicut elegit nos in ipso ante mundi constitutionem, ut essemus sancti et immaculati in conspectu eius in caritate,
verses.english: even as He chose us in Him before the beginning of the universe, that we should be holy and without blemish before Him in love,

verses.latin: qui praedestinavit nos in adoptionem filiorum per Iesum Christum in ipsum: secundum propositum voluntatis suae,
verses.english: who predestined us to be adopted as sons through Jesus Christ to Himself, according to the purpose of His will,

verses.latin: in laudem gloriae gratiae suae, in qua gratificavit nos in dilecto Filio suo.
verses.english: to the praise of the glory of His grace, with which He has graced us in His beloved Son.

verses.latin: In quo habemus redemptionem per sanguinem eius, remissionem peccatorum secundum divitias gratiae eius,
verses.english: In Him we have redemption through His blood, the remission of sins according to the riches of His grace,

verses.latin: quae superabundavit in nobis in omni sapientia et prudentia,
verses.english: which He poured out on us in all wisdom and prudence,

verses.latin: ut notum faceret nobis sacramentum voluntatis suae, secundum beneplacitum eius, quod proposuit in eo,
verses.english: making known to us the mystery of His will, according to His good pleasure which He purposed in Him,

verses.latin: in dispensationem plenitudinis temporum: instaurare omnia in Christo, quae in caelis et quae in terra sunt, in ipso;
verses.english: to be carried out in the fullness of time: that He would bring all things together in Christ, those in the universe and those on the earth—in Him;

verses.latin: in quo etiam et nos sorte vocati sumus, praedestinati secundum propositum eius qui operatur omnia secundum consilium voluntatis suae:
verses.english: in whom also we have obtained an inheritance, having been predestined according to the purpose of Him who works all things according to the counsel of His will,

verses.latin: ut simus in laudem gloriae eius nos, qui ante speravimus in Christo,
verses.english: so that we who first hoped in Christ might be to the praise of His glory.

verses.latin: in quo et vos, cum audissetis verbum veritatis, Evangelium salutis vestrae, in quo et credentes signati estis Spiritu promissionis sancto,
verses.english: In Him, you also, after listening to the word of truth, the Gospel of your salvation—in Him, after you also believed, you were sealed with the Holy Spirit of promise,

verses.latin: qui est pignus hereditatis nostrae, in redemptione acquisitionis, in laudem gloriae eius.
verses.english: who is the pledge of our inheritance, with a view to the redemption of God's own possession, to the praise of His glory.

verses.latin: Propterea et ego, audiens fidem vestram, quae est in Domino Iesu, et dilectionem in omnes sanctos,
verses.english: For this reason I also, having heard of the faith in the Lord Jesus which is among you and your love for all the saints,

verses.latin: non cesso gratias agens pro vobis, memoriam faciens in orationibus meis,
verses.english: do not cease to give thanks for you, while making mention of you in my prayers,

verses.latin: ut Deus Domini nostri Iesu Christi, Pater gloriae, det vobis spiritum sapientiae et revelationis in agnitione eius,
verses.english: that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, may give you a spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of Him,

verses.latin: illuminatos oculos cordis vestri, ut sciatis quae sit spes vocationis eius, et quae divitiae gloriae hereditatis eius in sanctis,
verses.english: the eyes of your heart being enlightened, so that you may know what is the hope of His calling, what are the riches of the glory of His inheritance in the saints,

verses.latin: et quae sit supereminens magnitudo virtutis eius in nos, qui credimus secundum operationem potentiae virtutis eius,
verses.english: and what is the surpassing greatness of His power toward us who believe, in accordance with the working of the strength of His might,

verses.latin: quam operatus est in Christo, suscitans eum a mortuis, et constituens ad dexteram suam in caelestibus,
verses.english: which He brought about in Christ, when He raised Him from the dead and seated Him at His right hand in the universe,

verses.latin: supra omnem principatum, et potestatem, et virtutem, et dominationem, et omne nomen quod nominatur, non solum in hoc saeculo, sed etiam in futuro.
verses.english: far above all rule and authority and power and dominion, and every name that is named, not only in this age but also in the one to come.

verses.latin: Et omnia subjecit sub pedibus eius: et ipsum dedit caput supra omnem ecclesiam,
verses.english: And He put all things in subjection under His feet, and gave Him as head over all things to the Church,

verses.latin: quae est corpus eius, et plenitudo eius, qui omnia in omnibus adimpletur.
verses.english: which is His body, the fullness of Him who fills all in all.

verses.latin: Et vos cum essetis mortui delictis et peccatis vestris,
verses.english: When you were dead, because of your sins and failings,

verses.latin: in quibus ambulastis aliquando secundum saeculum mundi hujus, secundum principem potestatis aeris hujus, spiritus qui nunc operatur in filiis diffidentiae,
verses.english: you lived according to the ways of the world. You followed the devil, the prince of the power of the air, the evil spirit who now works in those who do not believe,

verses.latin: in quibus et nos omnes conversati sumus aliquando in desideriis carnis nostrae, facientes voluntatem carnis et cogitationum: et eramus natura filii irae, sicut et ceteri.
verses.english: Like them, we all once lived in the desires of our flesh, doing what our flesh and minds wanted. We were by nature children of wrath, like everyone else.

verses.latin: Deus autem, qui dives est in misericordia, propter nimiam charitatem suam qua dilexit nos,
verses.english: But God, who is rich in mercy, because of his great love for us,

verses.latin: et cum mortui essemus peccatis, vivificavit nos in Christo (cujus gratia estis salvati),
verses.english: made us alive with Christ, even when we were dead in sins. God saved you by his grace.

verses.latin: et suscitavit simul, et consedere fecit in caelestibus in Christo Jesu,
verses.english: And God raised us up with Christ and seated us with him in the heavens,

verses.latin: ut ostenderet in saeculis supervenientibus, abundantem divitiarum gratiae suae, in bonitate super nos in Christo Jesu.
verses.english: to show in the ages to come the immeasurable riches of his grace in kindness toward us in Christ Jesus.

verses.latin: Gratia enim estis salvati per fidem, et hoc non ex vobis: Dei enim donum est.
verses.english: For by grace you have been saved through faith, and this is not your own doing; it is the gift of God,

verses.latin: Non ex operibus, ut ne quis glorietur.
verses.english: not because of works, lest anyone should boast.

verses.latin: Ipsius enim factura sumus, creati in Christo Jesu in operibus bonis, quae praeparavit Deus ut in illis ambulemus.
verses.english: For we are his workmanship, created in Christ Jesus for good works, which God prepared beforehand, that we should walk in them.

verses.latin: Propter quod estote memores, quod aliquando vos gentes in carne, qui dicebamini praeputium ab ea quae dicitur circumcisione in carne, manu facta,
verses.english: Therefore remember that at one time you Gentiles in the flesh, called “the uncircumcision” by what is called the circumcision, which is done in the flesh by hands,

verses.latin: quod eratis illo in tempore sine Christo, alienati a conversatione Israel, et hospites testamentorum promissionis, spem non habentes, et sine Deo in mundo.
verses.english: were at that time separated from Christ, alienated from the commonwealth of Israel and strangers to the covenants of promise, having no hope and without God in the world.

verses.latin: Nunc autem in Christo Jesu, vos qui aliquando eratis longe, facti estis prope in sanguine Christi.
verses.english: But now in Christ Jesus you who once were far off have been brought near by the blood of Christ.

verses.latin: Ipse enim est pax nostra, qui fecit utraque unum, et medium parietis maceriae solvens inimicitias,
verses.english: For he himself is our peace, who has made us both one and has broken down in his flesh the dividing wall of hostility

verses.latin: et chirographum decretorum, quae erant adversus nos, tollens, et illud de medio tulit, adfigens illud cruci,
verses.english: by abolishing the law of commandments and ordinances, that he might create in himself one new man in place of the two, so making peace,

verses.latin: et reconciliaret ambos in uno corpore Deo per crucem, interficiens inimicitias in semetipso.
verses.english: and might reconcile us both to God in one body through the cross, thereby killing the hostility.

verses.latin: Et veniens evangelizavit pacem vobis qui prope, et pacem iis qui longe.
verses.english: And he came and preached peace to you who were far off and peace to those who were near.

verses.latin: Quoniam per ipsum habemus accessum uterque in uno Spiritu ad Patrem.
verses.english: For through him we both have access in one Spirit to the Father.

verses.latin: Ergo jam non estis hospites et advenae: sed estis cives sanctorum, et domestici Dei,
verses.english: So then you are no longer strangers and aliens, but you are fellow citizens with the saints and members of the household of God,

verses.latin: superaedificati super fundamentum Apostolorum et prophetarum, ipso summo angulari lapide Christo Jesu:
verses.english: built on the foundation of the apostles and prophets, Christ Jesus himself being the cornerstone,

verses.latin: in quo omnis aedificatio constructa crescit in templum sanctum in Domino,
verses.english: in whom the whole structure, being joined together, grows into a holy temple in the Lord.

verses.latin: in quo et vos coaedificamini in habitaculum Dei in Spiritu.
verses.english: In him you also are being built together into a dwelling place for God by the Spirit.

verses.latin: Hujus rei gratia ego Paulus vinctus Christi Iesu pro vobis gentibus,
verses.english: For this cause, I, Paul, the one imprisoned for the sake of Jesus Christ for the sake of you who are not Jews—

verses.latin: si tamen audistis dispensationem gratiæ Dei, quæ data est mihi in vobis:
verses.english: Assuming you’ve heard about the special plan of God’s grace, which was given to me for your sake:

verses.latin: quoniam per revelationem mihi notum factum est mysterium, sicut supra scripsi in brevi,
verses.english: That by a direct revelation, I have come to understand the mystery of the Church—just as I have written briefly above—

verses.latin: in quo potes, legentes, intelligere prudentiam meam in mysterio Christi:
verses.english: By reading this, you will see my insight into the mystery of Christ.

verses.latin: quod aliis generationibus non est manifestatum filiis hominum, sicut nunc revelatum est sanctis apostolis ejus et prophetis in Spiritu,
verses.english: This mystery was not made known to those who lived in past generations, but now it has been revealed to the holy apostles and prophets, through the Holy Spirit:

verses.latin: esse gentes cohæredes, et concorporales, et comparticipes promissionis in Christo Iesu per Evangelium:
verses.english: That the non-Jews are co-heirs and members of the same body, who share in the promises in Christ Jesus, through the Gospel:

verses.latin: cujus factus sum minister secundum donum gratiæ Dei, quæ data est mihi secundum operationem virtutis ejus:
verses.english: Of this Gospel, I have become a servant, through the gift of God’s grace, which was given to me through the working of His power.

verses.latin: mihi minimo omnium sanctorum data est gratia hæc, in gentibus evangelizare investigabilem divitias Christi,
verses.english: This grace was given to me, who is the least of all the saints: that I should announce the good news of Christ’s riches to all the non-Jewish nations.

verses.latin: et illuminare omnes, quæ sit dispensatio sacramenti absconditi a sæculis in Deo, qui omnia creavit:
verses.english: And to give understanding of what is the plan of this mystery, which was hidden for all time in God, who created all things.

verses.latin: ut innotescat nunc principatibus et potestatibus in cælestibus per Ecclesiam, multiformis sapientia Dei,
verses.english: The purpose of this is that, now, the principalities and powers in the universe may come to know the many forms of God’s wisdom, through the Church.

verses.latin: secundum propositum æternum, quod fecit in Christo Iesu Domino nostro:
verses.english: This plan was according to the eternal intention, which He made in Christ Jesus Our Lord:

verses.latin: in quo habemus fiduciam et accessum in confidentia per fidem ejus.
verses.english: In Him we have confidence, and through faith in Him, we are free to approach God.

verses.latin: Propter quod peto ne deficiatis in tribulationibus meis pro vobis: quæ est gloria vestra.
verses.english: So I ask that you do not be discouraged by my sufferings for your sake, which is your glory.

verses.latin: Hujus rei gratia flecto genua mea ad Patrem Domini nostri Iesu Christi,
verses.english: Because of this, I bow my knees before the Father of Our Lord Jesus Christ,

verses.latin: ex quo omnis familia in cælis et in terra nominatur,
verses.english: From whom all family in the universe, and on the earth, are named.

verses.latin: ut det vobis secundum divitias gloriæ suæ, virtute corroborari per Spiritum ejus in interiore homine,
verses.english: May He grant that you, according to the riches of His glory, be strengthened with power through His Spirit in the inner self,

verses.latin: habitare Christum per fidem in cordibus vestris: in caritate radicati et fundati,
verses.english: That Christ may dwell in your hearts through faith; may you be rooted and grounded in love,

verses.latin: ut possitis comprehendere cum omnibus sanctis, quæ sit latitudo, et longitudo, et sublimitas, et profundum:
verses.english: So that you may have the power to comprehend, with all the saints, what is the breadth, and length, and height, and depth—

verses.latin: scire etiam supereminentem scientiæ caritatem Christi, ut impleamini in omnem plenitudinem Dei.
verses.english: To know also the surpassing love of Christ, that you may be filled with all the fullness of God.

verses.latin: Ei autem qui potens est omnia facere superabundanter quam petimus aut intelligimus, secundum virtutem quæ operatur in nobis:
verses.english: Now to Him who is able to do far more abundantly than all that we ask or think, according to the power at work within us,

verses.latin: ipsi gloria in Ecclesia, et in Christo Iesu, in omnes generationes sæculi sæculorum. Amen.
verses.english: To Him be glory in the Church and in Christ Jesus throughout all generations, forever and ever. Amen.

verses.latin: Obsecro itaque vos ego vinctus in Domino, ut digne ambuletis vocatione qua vocati estis:
verses.english: So I, a prisoner for the Lord, beg you to live a life worthy of the calling you have received.

verses.latin: cum omni humilitate et mansuetudine, cum patientia, supportantes invicem in charitate,
verses.english: Be humble and gentle, be patient, bearing with one another in love,

verses.latin: solliciti servare unitatem spiritus in vinculo pacis.
verses.english: make every effort to keep the unity of the Spirit through the bond of peace.

verses.latin: Unum corpus, et unus spiritus: sicut vocati estis in una spe vocationis vestrae.
verses.english: There is one body and one Spirit, just as you were called to one hope when you were called,

verses.latin: Unus Dominus, una fides, unum baptisma,
verses.english: one Lord, one faith, one baptism,

verses.latin: unus Deus et Pater omnium, qui est super omnes, et per omnia, et in omnibus nobis.
verses.english: one God and Father of all, who is over all, and through all, and in all.

verses.latin: Unicuique autem nostrum data est gratia secundum mensuram donationis Christi.
verses.english: But to each one of us grace has been given as Christ apportioned it.

verses.latin: Propter quod dicit: Ascendens in altum captivam duxit captivitatem, dedit dona hominibus.
verses.english: This is why it says: “When he ascended on high, he took many captives and gave gifts to mankind.”

verses.latin: Quod autem ascendit, quid est, nisi quia et descendit primum in inferiores partes terrae?
verses.english: (What does “he ascended” mean except that he also descended to the lower, earthly regions?

verses.latin: Qui descendit, ipse est et qui ascendit super omnes caelos, ut impleret omnia.
verses.english: He who descended is the very one who ascended higher than all the heavens, in order to fill the whole universe.)

verses.latin: Et ipse dedit quosdam quidem apostolos, quosdam autem prophetas, alios vero evangelistas, alios autem pastores et doctores,
verses.english: So Christ himself gave the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, the pastors and teachers,

verses.latin: ad consummationem sanctorum in opus ministerii, in aedificationem corporis Christi:
verses.english: to equip his people for works of service, so that the body of Christ may be built up

verses.latin: donec occurramus omnes in unitatem fidei et agnitionis Filii Dei, in virum perfectum, in mensuram aetatis plenitudinis Christi:
verses.english: until we all reach unity in the faith and in the knowledge of the Son of God, as we mature to the full measure of the stature of Christ.

verses.latin: ut jam non simus parvuli fluctuantes, et circumferamur omni vento doctrinae, in nequitia hominum, in astutia ad circumventionem erroris:
verses.english: Then we will no longer be infants, tossed back and forth by the waves, and blown here and there by every wind of teaching and by the cunning and craftiness of people in their deceitful scheming.

verses.latin: veritatem autem in charitate sequentes, crescamus in illo per omnia, qui est caput Christus:
verses.english: Instead, speaking the truth in love, we will grow to become in every respect the mature body of him who is the head, that is, Christ.

verses.latin: ex quo totum corpus compactum et connexum per omnem juncturam subministrationis, secundum operationem in mensuram uniuscujusque membri, augmentum corporis facit in aedificationem sui in charitate.
verses.english: From him the whole body, joined and held together by every supporting ligament, grows and builds itself up in love, as each part does its work.

verses.latin: Hoc igitur dico, et testificor in Domino, ut jam non ambuletis, sicut et gentes ambulant in vanitate sensus sui:
verses.english: So I tell you this, and insist on it in the Lord, that you must no longer live as the Gentiles do, in the futility of their thinking.

verses.latin: tenebris obscuratum habentes intellectum, alienati a vita Dei per ignorantiam, quae est in illis, propter caecitatem cordis ipsorum:
verses.english: They are darkened in their understanding and separated from the life of God because of the ignorance that is in them due to the hardening of their hearts.

verses.latin: qui, desperantes, tradiderunt se impudicitiae, in operationem immunditiae, cum avaritia.
verses.english: Having lost all sensitivity, they have given themselves over to sensuality so as to indulge in every kind of impurity, and they are full of greed.

verses.latin: Vos autem non sic didicistis Christum:
verses.english: That, however, is not the way of life you learned

verses.latin: si tamen illum audistis, et in ipso didicistis, sicut est veritas in Jesu:
verses.english: when you heard about Christ and were taught in him in accordance with the truth that is in Jesus.

verses.latin: deponere vos secundum pristinam conversationem, veterem hominem, qui corrumpitur secundum desideria erroris.
verses.english: You were taught, with regard to your former way of life, to put off your old self, which is being corrupted by its deceitful desires;

verses.latin: Renovamini autem spiritu mentis vestrae:
verses.english: to be made new in the attitude of your minds;

verses.latin: et induite novum hominem, qui secundum Deum creatus est in justitia et sanctitate veritatis.
verses.english: and to put on the new self, created to be like God in true righteousness and holiness.

verses.latin: Propter quod deponentes mendacium, loquimini veritatem unusquisque cum proximo suo: quoniam sumus invicem membra.
verses.english: Therefore each of you must put off falsehood and speak truthfully to your neighbor, for we are all members of one body.

verses.latin: Irascimini, et nolite peccare: sol non occidat super iracundiam vestram.
verses.english: “In your anger do not sin”: Do not let the sun go down while you are still angry,

verses.latin: Neque locum detis diabolo.
verses.english: and do not give the devil a foothold.

verses.latin: Qui furabatur, jam non furetur: sed magis laboret, operans manibus suis quod bonum est, ut habeat unde tribuat necessitatibus.
verses.english: Anyone who has been stealing must steal no longer, but must work, doing something useful with their own hands, that they may have something to share with those in need.

verses.latin: Omnis sermo malus ex ore vestro non procedat: sed si quis bonus est ad aedificationem fidei, ut det gratiam audientibus.
verses.english: Do not let any unwholesome talk come out of your mouths, but only what is helpful for building others up according to their needs, that it may benefit those who listen.

verses.latin: Et nolite contristare Spiritum Sanctum Dei: in quo signati estis in diem redemptionis.
verses.english: And do not grieve the Holy Spirit of God, with whom you were sealed for the day of redemption.

verses.latin: Omnis amaritudo, et ira, et indignatio, et clamor, et blasphemia tollatur a vobis cum omni malitia.
verses.english: Get rid of all bitterness, rage and anger, brawling and slander, along with every form of malice.

verses.latin: Estote autem invicem benigni, misericordes, donantes invicem, sicut et Deus donavit vobis in Christo.
verses.english: Be kind and compassionate to one another, forgiving each other, just as in Christ God forgave you.

verses.latin: Estote ergo imitatores Dei, sicut filii carissimi:
verses.english: So, become imitators of God, as beloved children.

verses.latin: et ambulate in dilectione, sicut et Christus dilexit nos, et tradidit seipsum pro nobis, oblationem et hostiam Deo in odorem suavitatis.
verses.english: And walk in love, just as Christ loved us, and offered Himself for us, an offering and sacrifice to God for a pleasing fragrance.

verses.latin: Fornicatio autem, et omnis immunditia, aut avaritia, nec nominetur in vobis, sicut decet sanctos:
verses.english: But fornication and every impurity or greed, let it not even be named among you, as is fitting for saints.

verses.latin: aut turpitudo, aut stultiloquium, aut scurrilitas, quae ad rem non pertinet: sed magis gratiarum actio.
verses.english: Or indecency, or foolish talk, or obscenity, which are not becoming, but rather thanksgiving.

verses.latin: Hoc enim scitote et intellegite: quod omnis fornicator, aut immundus, aut avarus, quod est idolorum servitus, non habet hereditatem in regno Christi et Dei.
verses.english: For know and understand this: that every fornicator or impure person or the greedy, who is a servant of idols, does not have an inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and of God.

verses.latin: Nemo vos seducat vanis verbis: propter haec enim venit ira Dei in filios diffidentiae.
verses.english: Let no one deceive you with empty words, for because of these things comes the wrath of God upon the sons of disobedience.

verses.latin: Nolite ergo fieri participes eorum.
verses.english: Therefore, do not be partakers with them.

verses.latin: Eratis enim aliquando tenebrae: nunc autem lux in Domino. Ut filii lucis ambulate:
verses.english: For you were once darkness, but now you are light in the Lord. Walk as children of light.

verses.latin: (fructus enim lucis est in omni bonitate et justitia et veritate),
verses.english: (for the fruit of light is in all goodness and justice and truth),

verses.latin: probantes quid sit beneplacitum Deo:
verses.english: proving what is pleasing to God.

verses.latin: et nolite communicare operibus infructuosis tenebrarum, sed magis redarguite.
verses.english: And do not share in the unfruitful works of darkness, but rather reprove them.

verses.latin: Quae enim in secreto fiunt ab ipsis, turpe est et dicere.
verses.english: For the things done by them in secret, it is shameful even to speak of.

verses.latin: Omnia autem, quae arguitur, a lumine manifestantur.
verses.english: But all things that are reproved are made manifest by the light.

verses.latin: Omne enim, quod manifestatur, lux est.
verses.english: For everything that is made manifest is light.

verses.latin: Propter quod dicit: Surge, qui dormis, et exsurge a mortuis: et illuminabit te Christus.
verses.english: Therefore, it says: "Awake, you who sleep, and arise from the dead, and Christ will enlighten you."

verses.latin: Videte itaque, fratres, quomodo caute ambuletis: non quasi insipientes,
verses.english: See, therefore, brothers, how carefully you walk: not as unwise,

verses.latin: sed ut sapientes: redimentes tempus, quoniam dies mali sunt.
verses.english: but as wise, redeeming the time, because the days are evil.

verses.latin: Propterea nolite fieri imprudentes, sed intelligentes quae sit voluntas Dei.
verses.english: Therefore, do not become foolish, but understanding what the will of God is.

verses.latin: Et nolite inebriari vino, in quo est luxuria, sed implemini Spiritu Sancto,
verses.english: And do not be drunk with wine, in which is debauchery, but be filled with the Holy Spirit,

verses.latin: loquentes vobismetipsis in psalmis et hymnis et canticis spiritualibus, cantantes et psallentes in cordibus vestris Domino,
verses.english: speaking to yourselves in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing and making melody in your hearts to the Lord,

verses.latin: gratias agentes semper pro omnibus in nomine Domini nostri Jesu Christi Deo et Patri:
verses.english: giving thanks always for all things in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ to God and the Father:

verses.latin: Subditi invicem in timore Christi.
verses.english: Be subject to one another in the fear of Christ.

verses.latin: Mulieres, viris suis subditae sint, sicut Domino:
verses.english: Wives, be subject to your husbands, as to the Lord.

verses.latin: quoniam vir caput est mulieris, sicut Christus caput est Ecclesiae: ipse salvator corporis ejus.
verses.english: For the husband is the head of the wife, as Christ is the head of the Church: He is the Savior of His body.

verses.latin: Sed sicut Ecclesia subjecta est Christo, ita et mulieres viris suis in omnibus.
verses.english: But as the Church is subject to Christ, so also let wives be to their husbands in all things.

verses.latin: Viri, diligite uxores vestras, sicut et Christus dilexit Ecclesiam, et seipsum tradidit pro ea:
verses.english: Husbands, love your wives, just as Christ loved the Church, and gave Himself up for her,

verses.latin: ut illam sanctificaret, mundans lavacro aquae in verbo vitae,
verses.english: that He might sanctify her, cleansing her by the washing of water with the word of life,

verses.latin: ut exhiberet ipsam sibi gloriosam Ecclesiam, non habentem maculam, aut rugam, aut aliquid hujusmodi, sed ut sit sancta et immaculata.
verses.english: that He might present her to Himself a glorious Church, not having spot or wrinkle or any such thing, but that she should be holy and without blemish.

verses.latin: Ita et viri debent diligere uxores suas ut corpora sua. Qui suam uxorem diligit, seipsum diligit.
verses.english: So also husbands should love their wives as their own bodies. He who loves his wife loves himself.

verses.latin: Nemo enim umquam odiit carnem suam: sed nutrit et fovet eam, sicut et Christus Ecclesiam:
verses.english: For no one ever hated his own flesh: but nourishes and cherishes it, as also Christ does the Church:

verses.latin: quia membra sumus corporis ejus, de carne ejus et de ossibus ejus.
verses.english: because we are members of His body, of His flesh and of His bones.

verses.latin: Propter hoc relinquet homo patrem et matrem, et adherebit uxori suae, et erunt duo in carne una.
verses.english: “Therefore a man shall leave his father and his mother and be joined to his wife, and the two shall become one flesh.”

verses.latin: Sacramentum hoc magnum est; ego autem dico in Christo et in Ecclesia.
verses.english: This is a great mystery, and I mean in Christ and in the Church.

verses.latin: Filii, obedite parentibus vestris in Domino: hoc enim justum est.
verses.english: Children, obey your parents in the Lord; this is right.

verses.latin: Honora patrem tuum et matrem: quod est mandatum primum in promissione:
verses.english: “Honor your father and your mother.” This is the first commandment with a promise:

verses.latin: ut bene sit tibi, et sis longaevus super terram.
verses.english: “that it may be well with you and that you may live long on the earth.”

verses.latin: Et vos patres, nolite ad iracundiam provocare filios vestros: sed educate illos in disciplina et correptione Domini.
verses.english: And, you fathers, do not provoke your children to wrath, but bring them up in the discipline and correction of the Lord.

verses.latin: Servi, obedite dominis carnalibus cum timore et tremore, in simplicitate cordis vestri, sicut Christo:
verses.english: Slaves, be obedient to those who are your masters according to the flesh, with fear and trembling, in the simplicity of your heart, as to Christ:

verses.latin: non ad oculum servientes, quasi hominibus placentes, sed ut servi Christi, facientes voluntatem Dei ex animo:
verses.english: Not serving to the eye, as pleasing men, but as servants of Christ, doing the will of God from the heart,

verses.latin: cum bona voluntate servientes, sicut Domino, et non hominibus:
verses.english: Serving with good will as to the Lord, and not to men:

verses.latin: scientes quoniam unusquisque quodcumque fecerit bonum, hoc recipiet a Domino, sive servus, sive liber.
verses.english: Knowing that whatever good anyone does, this he will receive from the Lord, whether slave or free.

verses.latin: Et vos domini, eadem facite ad illos, remittentes minas: scientes quoniam et illorum et vester Dominus est in caelis: et personarum acceptio non est apud illum.
verses.english: And, you masters, do the same things to them, remitting threats, knowing that both theirs and yours is the Lord in heaven, and there is no respect of persons with Him.

verses.latin: De cetero, confortamini in Domino, et in potentia virtutis ejus.
verses.english: For the rest, be strengthened in the Lord and in the power of His might.

verses.latin: Induite vos armaturam Dei, ut possitis stare adversus insidias diaboli.
verses.english: Put on the armor of God, that you may be able to stand against the deceits of the devil.

verses.latin: Quoniam non est nobis conluctatio adversus carnem et sanguinem, sed adversus principes et potestates, adversus mundi rectores tenebrarum harum, contra spiritualia nequitiae, in caelestibus.
verses.english: For we are not wrestling against flesh and blood, but against principalities and powers, against the world rulers of this darkness, against the spiritual wickedness in the high places.

verses.latin: Propterea, assumite armaturam Dei, ut possitis resistere in die malo, et in omnibus perfecti stare.
verses.english: Therefore, take up the armor of God, that you may be able to resist in the evil day and, being perfect in all things, to stand.

verses.latin: State ergo succincti lumbos vestros in veritate, et induti loricam justitiae,
verses.english: Stand, therefore, having your loins girt about with truth and having put on the breastplate of justice,

verses.latin: et calceati pedes in praeparatione evangelii pacis:
verses.english: And having your feet shod with the preparation of the gospel of peace:

verses.latin: in omnibus sumentes scutum fidei, in quo possitis omnia tela nequissimi ignea extinguere.
verses.english: In all things, taking up the shield of faith, with which you may be able to extinguish all the fiery darts of the wicked one.

verses.latin: Et galeam salutis assumite, et gladium spiritus (quod est verbum Dei),
verses.english: And take the helmet of salvation and the sword of the Spirit (which is the word of God).

verses.latin: per omnem orationem et obsecrationem orantes omni tempore in spiritu: et in hoc vigilantes cum omni instantia et obsecratione pro omnibus sanctis:
verses.english: By every prayer and supplication, praying at all times in the spirit, and in this watching with all insistence and supplication for all the saints:

verses.latin: et pro me, ut detur mihi sermo in apertione oris mei, cum fiducia notum facere mysterium evangelii:
verses.english: And for me, that speech may be given to me, in the opening of my mouth, with confidence to make known the mystery of the gospel:

verses.latin: pro quo legatione fungor in catena, ut audeam in ipso, sicut oportet me loqui.
verses.english: For which I am an ambassador in a chain, so that I may dare to speak it, as I ought to speak.

verses.latin: Ut autem et vos sciatis quae circa me sunt, et quid agam, omnia vobis nota faciet Tychicus, charissimus frater, et fidelis minister in Domino:
verses.english: But that you also may know the things concerning me, and what I am doing, Tychicus, the most beloved brother and a faithful minister in the Lord, will make all things known to you:

verses.latin: quem misi ad vos in hoc ipsum, ut cognoscatis quae circa nos sunt, et consolatur corda vestra.
verses.english: Whom I have sent to you for this very thing, that you may know the things concerning us, and that he may comfort your hearts.

verses.latin: Pax fratribus, et charitas cum fide a Deo Patre, et Domino Jesu Christo.
verses.english: Peace to the brethren, and love with faith from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.latin: Gratia cum omnibus qui diligunt Dominum nostrum Jesum Christum in incorruptione. Amen.
verses.english: Grace with all those who love our Lord Jesus Christ in incorruption. Amen.
